id.docs:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The ID of this servo so that it can be controlled.



*See also: [Servo Component](https://esphome.io/components/servo.html#configuration-variables)*

output.docs:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The ID of the [output component](https://esphome.io/components/output/index.html) to use for this servo.



*See also: [Servo Component](https://esphome.io/components/servo.html#configuration-variables)*

min_level.docs:
**percentage**: The PWM duty cycle the minimum value (-100%) will map to. Defaults to `3%`.



*See also: [Servo Component](https://esphome.io/components/servo.html#configuration-variables)*

idle_level.docs:
**percentage**: The PWM duty cycle the idle value (0%) will map to. This is also the state of the servo at startup. Defaults to `7.5%`.



*See also: [Servo Component](https://esphome.io/components/servo.html#configuration-variables)*

max_level.docs:
**percentage**: The PWM duty cycle the maximum value (100%) will map to. Defaults to `12.0%`.



*See also: [Servo Component](https://esphome.io/components/servo.html#configuration-variables)*

restore.docs:
**boolean**: Whether to restore the state of the servo motor at startup. This is useful if you have an absolute servo motor and it goes back to its 0 position at startup. Defaults to `false`.



*See also: [Servo Component](https://esphome.io/components/servo.html#configuration-variables)*

auto_detach_time.docs:
**[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)**: The time after reaching the target value when the servo will be detached`, if set to zero, servo will not be detached. Defaults to `0s`.



*See also: [Servo Component](https://esphome.io/components/servo.html#configuration-variables)*

transition_length.docs:
**[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)**: The time needed for a full movement (-1.0 to 1.0). This will effectively limit the speed of the servo, the larger the value, the slowest the servo will move. Defaults to `` 0s`` This can slow down the servo to avoid loud noises or just make the movement not jerking.



*See also: [Servo Component](https://esphome.io/components/servo.html#configuration-variables)*

id.docs:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The ID of the servo.



*See also: [Servo Component](https://esphome.io/components/servo.html#servo-write-action)*

level.docs:
**percentage, [templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable)**: The target level. Range is from -100% to 100% (-1.0 to 1.0).



*See also: [Servo Component](https://esphome.io/components/servo.html#servo-write-action)*

write.docs:
To use your servo motor in [automations](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#automation) or templates, you can use this action to set the target level of the servo from -100% to 100%.

*See also: [Servo Component](https://esphome.io/components/servo.html#servo-write-action)*

detach.docs:
This [Action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-action) allows you to disable the output on a servo motor - this will make the servo motor stop immediately and disable its active control.

*See also: [Servo Component](https://esphome.io/components/servo.html#servo-detach-action)*
